problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box index
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: X and Y positions of each item within their assigned box

objective:
# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box_used: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_nr: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        if box_nr > max_box_used:
            max_box_used = box_nr
    return max_box_used

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)
constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = positions[i].x
        pos_y: int = positions[i].y
        assert pos_x + item_width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos_y + item_height <= BOX_HEIGHT

ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- constraints ---
def ensure_no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            if box_assignments[i] == box_assignments[j]:
                assert (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or \
                       (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x) or \
                       (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or \
                       (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)

ensure_no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert box_assignments[i] >= 1
        assert box_assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)

def ensure_position_bounds(
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].x <= 100
        assert positions[i].y >= 0
        assert positions[i].y <= 100

ensure_position_bounds(x_y_positions)

# --- constraints ---
def ensure_no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if item_box_assignments[i] == item_box_assignments[j]:

                # We assert that at least one of these non-overlapping conditions holds
                assert (
                    x_y_positions[i].x + items[i].width <= x_y_positions[j].x or
                    x_y_positions[j].x + items[j].width <= x_y_positions[i].x or
                    x_y_positions[i].y + items[i].height <= x_y_positions[j].y or
                    x_y_positions[j].y + items[j].height <= x_y_positions[i].y
                )

    nr_boxes: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure each item is assigned to a box within the valid range
        assert item_box_assignments[i] >= 1
        assert item_box_assignments[i] <= nr_boxes

ensure_each_item_in_exactly_one_box(item_box_assignments, nr_used_boxes)

Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box index
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: X and Y positions of each item within their assigned box

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item fits within the box boundaries
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT

fit_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping on x-axis
                x_not_overlapping: bool = (
                    positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or
                    positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x
                )
                # Check for non-overlapping on y-axis
                y_not_overlapping: bool = (
                    positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y or
                    positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y
                )
                # Assert that at least one axis does not overlap
                assert x_not_overlapping or y_not_overlapping

no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_and_position_validity(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item is placed within the boundaries of the box
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height
        # Ensure item is assigned to a valid box (already covered by Field bounds, but kept for clarity)
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_assignment_and_position_validity(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

})

    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---

nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)

x_y_positions : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
N_ITEMS : int = 20

# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=1, ub=20):

    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i] > max_box:
            max_box = assignments[i]
    return max_box

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

def ensure_item_fits_in_assigned_box(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = positions[i].x
        pos_y: int = positions[i].y
        assigned_box: int = box_assignments[i]
        
        # Ensure the item fits within the box boundaries
        assert pos_x + item_width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos_y + item_height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        assert pos_x >= 0
        assert pos_y >= 0

ensure_item_fits_in_assigned_box(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- constraints ---
def ensure_no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if box_assignments[i] == box_assignments[j]:
                # No overlap condition: one rectangle is to the left, right, above, or below the other
                assert (
                    positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or  # i is to the left of j
                    positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x or  # j is to the left of i
                    positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y or  # i is below j
                    positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y     # j is below i
                )

ensure_no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert box_assignments[i] >= 1
        assert box_assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.

        if box_nr > max_box_used:
            max_box_used = box_nr
    return max_box_used
